intro: Ottonia apodostachya, commonly known as the slender grass or narrow-leaf grass, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, which are typical of grasses. Ottonia apodostachya is often found in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its botanical features make it an important component of local ecosystems and a subject of study in plant taxonomy.
